  22: namespace LibMelanie\Lib;
  23: 
  24: /**
  25:  * Classe listant les objets VCard pour les convertions
  26:  * Elle se base sur la RFC 6350 VCard https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350
  27:  *
  28:  * @author PNE Messagerie/Apitech
  29:  * @package Librairie Mélanie2
  30:  * @subpackage Lib Mélanie2
  31:  *
  32:  */
  33: class VCard {
  34:     /****
  35:      * CONSTANTES
  36:      */
  37:   // General Properties
  38:   /**
  39:    * VCard component (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-6)
  40:    */
  41:   const VCARD = 'VCARD';
  42:   /**
  43:    * Purpose:  To denote the beginning of a syntactic entity within a
  44:       text/vcard content-type.
  45: 
  46:    Value type:  text
  47: 
  48:    Cardinality:  1
  49: 
  50:    Special notes:  The content entity MUST begin with the BEGIN property
  51:       with a value of "VCARD".  The value is case-insensitive.
  52: 
  53:       The BEGIN property is used in conjunction with the END property to
  54:       delimit an entity containing a related set of properties within a
  55:       text/vcard content-type.  This construct can be used instead of
  56:       including multiple vCards as body parts inside of a multipart/
  57:       alternative MIME message.  It is provided for applications that
  58:       wish to define content that can contain multiple entities within
  59:       the same text/vcard content-type or to define content that can be
  60:       identifiable outside of a MIME environment.
  61: 
  62:    ABNF:
  63: 
  64:      BEGIN-param = 0" "  ; no parameter allowed
  65:      BEGIN-value = "VCARD"
  66: 
  67:    Example:
  68: 
  69:          BEGIN:VCARD
  70: 
  71:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-6.1.1
  72:    */
  73:   const BEGIN = 'BEGIN';
  74:   /**
  75:    * Purpose:  To denote the end of a syntactic entity within a text/vcard
  76:       content-type.
  77: 
  78:    Value type:  text
  79: 
  80:    Cardinality:  1
  81: 
  82:    Special notes:  The content entity MUST end with the END type with a
  83:       value of "VCARD".  The value is case-insensitive.
  84:       The END property is used in conjunction with the BEGIN property to
  85:       delimit an entity containing a related set of properties within a
  86:       text/vcard content-type.  This construct can be used instead of or
  87:       in addition to wrapping separate sets of information inside
  88:       additional MIME headers.  It is provided for applications that
  89:       wish to define content that can contain multiple entities within
  90:       the same text/vcard content-type or to define content that can be
  91:       identifiable outside of a MIME environment.
  92: 
  93:    ABNF:
  94: 
  95:      END-param = 0" "  ; no parameter allowed
  96:      END-value = "VCARD"
  97: 
  98:    Example:
  99: 
 100:          END:VCARD
 101: 
 102:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-6.1.2
 103:    */
 104:   const END = 'END';
 105:   /**
 106:    * Purpose:  To identify the source of directory information contained
 107:       in the content type.
 108: 
 109:    Value type:  uri
 110: 
 111:    Cardinality:  *
 112: 
 113:    Special notes:  The SOURCE property is used to provide the means by
 114:       which applications knowledgable in the given directory service
 115:       protocol can obtain additional or more up-to-date information from
 116:       the directory service.  It contains a URI as defined in [RFC3986]
 117:       and/or other information referencing the vCard to which the
 118:       information pertains.  When directory information is available
 119:       from more than one source, the sending entity can pick what it
 120:       considers to be the best source, or multiple SOURCE properties can
 121:       be included.
 122: 
 123:    ABNF:
 124: 
 125:      SOURCE-param = "VALUE=uri" / pid-param / pref-param / altid-param
 126:                   / mediatype-param / any-param
 127:      SOURCE-value = URI
 128: 
 129:    Examples:
 130: 
 131:      SOURCE:ldap://ldap.example.com/cn=Babs%20Jensen,%20o=Babsco,%20c=US
 132:      SOURCE:http://directory.example.com/addressbooks/jdoe/
 133:       Jean%20Dupont.vcf
 134: 
 135:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-6.1.3
 136:    */
 137:   const SOURCE = 'SOURCE';
 138:   /**
 139:    * Purpose:  To specify the kind of object the vCard represents.
 140: 
 141:    Value type:  A single text value.
 142: 
 143:    Cardinality:  *1
 144: 
 145:    Special notes:  The value may be one of the following:
 146: 
 147:       "individual"  for a vCard representing a single person or entity.
 148:          This is the default kind of vCard.
 149: 
 150:       "group"  for a vCard representing a group of persons or entities.
 151:          The group's member entities can be other vCards or other types
 152:          of entities, such as email addresses or web sites.  A group
 153:          vCard will usually contain MEMBER properties to specify the
 154:          members of the group, but it is not required to.  A group vCard
 155:          without MEMBER properties can be considered an abstract
 156:          grouping, or one whose members are known empirically (perhaps
 157:          "IETF Participants" or "Republican U.S. Senators").
 158: 
 159:          All properties in a group vCard apply to the group as a whole,
 160:          and not to any particular MEMBER.  For example, an EMAIL
 161:          property might specify the address of a mailing list associated
 162:          with the group, and an IMPP property might refer to a group
 163:          chat room.
 164: 
 165:       "org"  for a vCard representing an organization.  An organization
 166:          vCard will not (in fact, MUST NOT) contain MEMBER properties,
 167:          and so these are something of a cross between "individual" and
 168:          "group".  An organization is a single entity, but not a person.
 169:          It might represent a business or government, a department or
 170:          division within a business or government, a club, an
 171:          association, or the like.
 172: 
 173:          All properties in an organization vCard apply to the
 174:          organization as a whole, as is the case with a group vCard.
 175:          For example, an EMAIL property might specify the address of a
 176:          contact point for the organization.
 177: 
 178:      "location"  for a named geographical place.  A location vCard will
 179:          usually contain a GEO property, but it is not required to.  A
 180:          location vCard without a GEO property can be considered an
 181:          abstract location, or one whose definition is known empirically
 182:          (perhaps "New England" or "The Seashore").
 183: 
 184:          All properties in a location vCard apply to the location
 185:          itself, and not with any entity that might exist at that
 186:          location.  For example, in a vCard for an office building, an
 187:          ADR property might give the mailing address for the building,
 188:          and a TEL property might specify the telephone number of the
 189:          receptionist.
 190: 
 191:       An x-name.  vCards MAY include private or experimental values for
 192:          KIND.  Remember that x-name values are not intended for general
 193:          use and are unlikely to interoperate.
 194: 
 195:       An iana-token.  Additional values may be registered with IANA (see
 196:          Section 10.3.4).  A new value's specification document MUST
 197:          specify which properties make sense for that new kind of vCard
 198:          and which do not.
 199: 
 200:       Implementations MUST support the specific string values defined
 201:       above.  If this property is absent, "individual" MUST be assumed
 202:       as the default.  If this property is present but the
 203:       implementation does not understand its value (the value is an
 204:       x-name or iana-token that the implementation does not support),
 205:       the implementation SHOULD act in a neutral way, which usually
 206:       means treating the vCard as though its kind were "individual".
 207:       The presence of MEMBER properties MAY, however, be taken as an
 208:       indication that the unknown kind is an extension of "group".
 209: 
 210:       Clients often need to visually distinguish contacts based on what
 211:       they represent, and the KIND property provides a direct way for
 212:       them to do so.  For example, when displaying contacts in a list,
 213:       an icon could be displayed next to each one, using distinctive
 214:       icons for the different kinds; a client might use an outline of a
 215:       single person to represent an "individual", an outline of multiple
 216:       people to represent a "group", and so on.  Alternatively, or in
 217:       addition, a client might choose to segregate different kinds of
 218:       vCards to different panes, tabs, or selections in the user
 219:       interface.
 220: 
 221:       Some clients might also make functional distinctions among the
 222:       kinds, ignoring "location" vCards for some purposes and
 223:       considering only "location" vCards for others.
 224: 
 225:       When designing those sorts of visual and functional distinctions,
 226:       client implementations have to decide how to fit unsupported kinds
 227:       into the scheme.  What icon is used for them?  The one for
 228:       "individual"?  A unique one, such as an icon of a question mark?
 229:       Which tab do they go into?  It is beyond the scope of this
 230:       specification to answer these questions, but these are things
 231:       implementers need to consider.
 232: 
 233:    ABNF:
 234: 
 235:      KIND-param = "VALUE=text" / any-param
 236:      KIND-value = "individual" / "group" / "org" / "location"
 237:                 / iana-token / x-name
 238: 
 239:    Example:
 240: 
 241:       This represents someone named Jane Doe working in the marketing
 242:       department of the North American division of ABC Inc.
 243: 
 244:          BEGIN:VCARD
 245:          VERSION:4.0
 246:          KIND:individual
 247:          FN:Jane Doe
 248:          ORG:ABC\, Inc.;North American Division;Marketing
 249:          END:VCARD
 250: 
 251:    This represents the department itself, commonly known as ABC
 252:    Marketing.
 253: 
 254:          BEGIN:VCARD
 255:          VERSION:4.0
 256:          KIND:org
 257:          FN:ABC Marketing
 258:          ORG:ABC\, Inc.;North American Division;Marketing
 259:          END:VCARD
 260: 
 261:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-6.1.4
 262:    */
 263:   const KIND = 'KIND';
 264:   /**
 265:    * Purpose:  To include extended XML-encoded vCard data in a plain
 266:       vCard.
 267: 
 268:    Value type:  A single text value.
 269: 
 270:    Cardinality:  *
 271: 
 272:    Special notes:  The content of this property is a single XML 1.0
 273:       [W3C.REC-xml-20081126] element whose namespace MUST be explicitly
 274:       specified using the xmlns attribute and MUST NOT be the vCard 4
 275:       namespace ("urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:vcard-4.0").  (This implies
 276:       that it cannot duplicate a standard vCard property.)  The element
 277:       is to be interpreted as if it was contained in a <vcard> element,
 278:       as defined in [RFC6351].
 279: 
 280:       The fragment is subject to normal line folding and escaping, i.e.,
 281:       replace all backslashes with "\\", then replace all newlines with
 282:       "\n", then fold long lines.
 283: 
 284:       Support for this property is OPTIONAL, but implementations of this
 285:       specification MUST preserve instances of this property when
 286:       propagating vCards.
 287: 
 288:       See [RFC6351] for more information on the intended use of this
 289:       property.
 290: 
 291:    ABNF:
 292: 
 293:      XML-param = "VALUE=text" / altid-param
 294:      XML-value = text
 295: 
 296:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-6.1.5
 297:    */
 298:   const XML = 'XML';
 299: 
 300:   // Identification Properties
 301:   /**
 302:    * Purpose:  To specify the formatted text corresponding to the name of
 303:       the object the vCard represents.
 304: 
 305:    Value type:  A single text value.
 306: 
 307:    Cardinality:  1*
 308: 
 309:    Special notes:  This property is based on the semantics of the X.520
 310:       Common Name attribute [CCITT.X520.1988].  The property MUST be
 311:       present in the vCard object.
 312: 
 313:    ABNF:
 314: 
 315:      FN-param = "VALUE=text" / type-param / language-param / altid-param
 316:               / pid-param / pref-param / any-param
 317:      FN-value = text
 318: 
 319:    Example:
 320: 
 321:          FN:Mr. John Q. Public\, Esq.
 322: 
 323:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-6.2.1
 324:    */
 325:   const FN = 'FN';
 326:   /**
 327:    * Purpose:  To specify the components of the name of the object the
 328:       vCard represents.
 329: 
 330:    Value type:  A single structured text value.  Each component can have
 331:       multiple values.
 332: 
 333:    Cardinality:  *1
 334: 
 335:    Special note:  The structured property value corresponds, in
 336:       sequence, to the Family Names (also known as surnames), Given
 337:       Names, Additional Names, Honorific Prefixes, and Honorific
 338:       Suffixes.  The text components are separated by the SEMICOLON
 339:       character (U+003B).  Individual text components can include
 340:       multiple text values separated by the COMMA character (U+002C).
 341:       This property is based on the semantics of the X.520 individual
 342:       name attributes [CCITT.X520.1988].  The property SHOULD be present
 343:       in the vCard object when the name of the object the vCard
 344:       represents follows the X.520 model.
 345: 
 346:       The SORT-AS parameter MAY be applied to this property.
 347: 
 348:    ABNF:
 349: 
 350:      N-param = "VALUE=text" / sort-as-param / language-param
 351:              / altid-param / any-param
 352:      N-value = list-component 4(";" list-component)
 353: 
 354:    Examples:
 355: 
 356:              N:Public;John;Quinlan;Mr.;Esq.
 357: 
 358:              N:Stevenson;John;Philip,Paul;Dr.;Jr.,M.D.,A.C.P.
 359: 
 360:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-6.2.2
 361:    */
 362:   const N = 'N';
 363:   /**
 364:    * Purpose:  To specify the text corresponding to the nickname of the
 365:       object the vCard represents.
 366: 
 367:    Value type:  One or more text values separated by a COMMA character
 368:       (U+002C).
 369: 
 370:    Cardinality:  *
 371: 
 372:    Special note:  The nickname is the descriptive name given instead of
 373:       or in addition to the one belonging to the object the vCard
 374:       represents.  It can also be used to specify a familiar form of a
 375:       proper name specified by the FN or N properties.
 376: 
 377:    ABNF:
 378: 
 379:      NICKNAME-param = "VALUE=text" / type-param / language-param
 380:                     / altid-param / pid-param / pref-param / any-param
 381:      NICKNAME-value = text-list
 382: 
 383:    Examples:
 384: 
 385:              NICKNAME:Robbie
 386: 
 387:              NICKNAME:Jim,Jimmie
 388: 
 389:              NICKNAME;TYPE=work:Boss
 390: 
 391:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-6.2.3
 392:    */
 393:   const NICKNAME = 'NICKNAME';
 394:   /**
 395:    * Purpose:  To specify an image or photograph information that
 396:       annotates some aspect of the object the vCard represents.
 397: 
 398:    Value type:  A single URI.
 399: 
 400:    Cardinality:  *
 401: 
 402:    ABNF:
 403: 
 404:      PHOTO-param = "VALUE=uri" / altid-param / type-param
 405:                  / mediatype-param / pref-param / pid-param / any-param
 406:      PHOTO-value = URI
 407: 
 408:    Examples:
 409: 
 410:        PHOTO:http://www.example.com/pub/photos/jqpublic.gif
 411: 
 412:        PHOTO:data:image/jpeg;base64,MIICajCCAdOgAwIBAgICBEUwDQYJKoZIhv
 413:         AQEEBQAwdzELMAkGA1UEBhMCVVMxLDAqBgNVBAoTI05ldHNjYXBlIENvbW11bm
 414:         ljYXRpb25zIENvcnBvcmF0aW9uMRwwGgYDVQQLExNJbmZvcm1hdGlvbiBTeXN0
 415:         <...remainder of base64-encoded data...>
 416: 
 417:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-6.2.4
 418:    */
 419:   const PHOTO = 'PHOTO';
 420:   /**
 421:    * Purpose:  To specify the birth date of the object the vCard
 422:       represents.
 423: 
 424:    Value type:  The default is a single date-and-or-time value.  It can
 425:       also be reset to a single text value.
 426: 
 427:    Cardinality:  *1
 428: 
 429:    ABNF:
 430: 
 431:      BDAY-param = BDAY-param-date / BDAY-param-text
 432:      BDAY-value = date-and-or-time / text
 433:        ; Value and parameter MUST match.
 434: 
 435:      BDAY-param-date = "VALUE=date-and-or-time"
 436:      BDAY-param-text = "VALUE=text" / language-param
 437: 
 438:      BDAY-param =/ altid-param / calscale-param / any-param
 439:        ; calscale-param can only be present when BDAY-value is
 440:        ; date-and-or-time and actually contains a date or date-time.
 441: 
 442:    Examples:
 443: 
 444:              BDAY:19960415
 445:              BDAY:--0415
 446:              BDAY;19531015T231000Z
 447:              BDAY;VALUE=text:circa 1800
 448:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-6.2.5
 449:    */
 450:   const BDAY = 'BDAY';
 451:   /**
 452:    *  Purpose:  The date of marriage, or equivalent, of the object the
 453:       vCard represents.
 454: 
 455:    Value type:  The default is a single date-and-or-time value.  It can
 456:       also be reset to a single text value.
 457: 
 458:    Cardinality:  *1
 459: 
 460:    ABNF:
 461: 
 462:      ANNIVERSARY-param = "VALUE=" ("date-and-or-time" / "text")
 463:      ANNIVERSARY-value = date-and-or-time / text
 464:        ; Value and parameter MUST match.
 465: 
 466:      ANNIVERSARY-param =/ altid-param / calscale-param / any-param
 467:        ; calscale-param can only be present when ANNIVERSARY-value is
 468:        ; date-and-or-time and actually contains a date or date-time.
 469: 
 470:    Examples:
 471: 
 472:              ANNIVERSARY:19960415
 473: 
 474:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-6.2.6
 475:    */
 476:   const ANNIVERSARY = 'ANNIVERSARY';
 477:   /**
 478:    * Purpose:  To specify the components of the sex and gender identity of
 479:       the object the vCard represents.
 480: 
 481:    Value type:  A single structured value with two components.  Each
 482:       component has a single text value.
 483: 
 484:    Cardinality:  *1
 485: 
 486:    Special notes:  The components correspond, in sequence, to the sex
 487:       (biological), and gender identity.  Each component is optional.
 488: 
 489:       Sex component:  A single letter.  M stands for "male", F stands
 490:          for "female", O stands for "other", N stands for "none or not
 491:          applicable", U stands for "unknown".
 492: 
 493:       Gender identity component:  Free-form text.
 494: 
 495:    ABNF:
 496: 
 497:                    GENDER-param = "VALUE=text" / any-param
 498:                    GENDER-value = sex [";" text]
 499: 
 500:                    sex = "" / "M" / "F" / "O" / "N" / "U"
 501: 
 502:    Examples:
 503: 
 504:      GENDER:M
 505:      GENDER:F
 506:      GENDER:M;Fellow
 507:      GENDER:F;grrrl
 508:      GENDER:O;intersex
 509:      GENDER:;it's complicated
 510: 
 511:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-6.2.7
 512:    */
 513:   const GENDER = 'GENDER';
 514: 
 515:   // Delivery Addressing Properties
 516:   /**
 517:    * Purpose:  To specify the components of the delivery address for the
 518:       vCard object.
 519: 
 520:    Value type:  A single structured text value, separated by the
 521:       SEMICOLON character (U+003B).
 522: 
 523:    Cardinality:  *
 524: 
 525:    Special notes:  The structured type value consists of a sequence of
 526:       address components.  The component values MUST be specified in
 527:       their corresponding position.  The structured type value
 528:       corresponds, in sequence, to
 529:          the post office box;
 530:          the extended address (e.g., apartment or suite number);
 531:          the street address;
 532:          the locality (e.g., city);
 533:          the region (e.g., state or province);
 534:          the postal code;
 535:          the country name (full name in the language specified in
 536:          Section 5.1).
 537: 
 538:       When a component value is missing, the associated component
 539:       separator MUST still be specified.
 540: 
 541:       Experience with vCard 3 has shown that the first two components
 542:       (post office box and extended address) are plagued with many
 543:       interoperability issues.  To ensure maximal interoperability,
 544:       their values SHOULD be empty.
 545: 
 546:       The text components are separated by the SEMICOLON character
 547:       (U+003B).  Where it makes semantic sense, individual text
 548:       components can include multiple text values (e.g., a "street"
 549:       component with multiple lines) separated by the COMMA character
 550:       (U+002C).
 551: 
 552:       The property can include the "PREF" parameter to indicate the
 553:       preferred delivery address when more than one address is
 554:       specified.
 555: 
 556:       The GEO and TZ parameters MAY be used with this property.
 557: 
 558:       The property can also include a "LABEL" parameter to present a
 559:       delivery address label for the address.  Its value is a plain-text
 560:       string representing the formatted address.  Newlines are encoded
 561:       as \n, as they are for property values.
 562: 
 563:    ABNF:
 564: 
 565:      label-param = "LABEL=" param-value
 566: 
 567:      ADR-param = "VALUE=text" / label-param / language-param
 568:                / geo-parameter / tz-parameter / altid-param / pid-param
 569:                / pref-param / type-param / any-param
 570: 
 571:      ADR-value = ADR-component-pobox ";" ADR-component-ext ";"
 572:                  ADR-component-street ";" ADR-component-locality ";"
 573:                  ADR-component-region ";" ADR-component-code ";"
 574:                  ADR-component-country
 575:      ADR-component-pobox    = list-component
 576:      ADR-component-ext      = list-component
 577:      ADR-component-street   = list-component
 578:      ADR-component-locality = list-component
 579:      ADR-component-region   = list-component
 580:      ADR-component-code     = list-component
 581:      ADR-component-country  = list-component
 582: 
 583:    Example: In this example, the post office box and the extended
 584:    address are absent.
 585: 
 586:      ADR;GEO="geo:12.3457,78.910";LABEL="Mr. John Q. Public, Esq.\n
 587:       Mail Drop: TNE QB\n123 Main Street\nAny Town, CA  91921-1234\n
 588:       U.S.A.":;;123 Main Street;Any Town;CA;91921-1234;U.S.A.
 589: 
 590:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-6.3.1
 591:    */
 592:   const ADR = 'ADR';
 593: 
 594:   // Communications Properties
 595:   /**
 596:    * Purpose:  To specify the telephone number for telephony communication
 597:       with the object the vCard represents.
 598: 
 599:    Value type:  By default, it is a single free-form text value (for
 600:       backward compatibility with vCard 3), but it SHOULD be reset to a
 601:       URI value.  It is expected that the URI scheme will be "tel", as
 602:       specified in [RFC3966], but other schemes MAY be used.
 603: 
 604:    Cardinality:  *
 605: 
 606:    Special notes:  This property is based on the X.520 Telephone Number
 607:       attribute [CCITT.X520.1988].
 608: 
 609:       The property can include the "PREF" parameter to indicate a
 610:       preferred-use telephone number.
 611: 
 612:       The property can include the parameter "TYPE" to specify intended
 613:       use for the telephone number.  The predefined values for the TYPE
 614:       parameter are:
 615: 
 616:    +-----------+-------------------------------------------------------+
 617:    | Value     | Description                                           |
 618:    +-----------+-------------------------------------------------------+
 619:    | text      | Indicates that the telephone number supports text     |
 620:    |           | messages (SMS).                                       |
 621:    | voice     | Indicates a voice telephone number.                   |
 622:    | fax       | Indicates a facsimile telephone number.               |
 623:    | cell      | Indicates a cellular or mobile telephone number.      |
 624:    | video     | Indicates a video conferencing telephone number.      |
 625:    | pager     | Indicates a paging device telephone number.           |
 626:    | textphone | Indicates a telecommunication device for people with  |
 627:    |           | hearing or speech difficulties.                       |
 628:    +-----------+-------------------------------------------------------+
 629: 
 630:       The default type is "voice".  These type parameter values can be
 631:       specified as a parameter list (e.g., TYPE=text;TYPE=voice) or as a
 632:       value list (e.g., TYPE="text,voice").  The default can be
 633:       overridden to another set of values by specifying one or more
 634:       alternate values.  For example, the default TYPE of "voice" can be
 635:       reset to a VOICE and FAX telephone number by the value list
 636:       TYPE="voice,fax".
 637: 
 638:       If this property's value is a URI that can also be used for
 639:       instant messaging, the IMPP (Section 6.4.3) property SHOULD be
 640:       used in addition to this property.
 641: 
 642:    ABNF:
 643: 
 644:      TEL-param = TEL-text-param / TEL-uri-param
 645:      TEL-value = TEL-text-value / TEL-uri-value
 646:        ; Value and parameter MUST match.
 647: 
 648:      TEL-text-param = "VALUE=text"
 649:      TEL-text-value = text
 650: 
 651:      TEL-uri-param = "VALUE=uri" / mediatype-param
 652:      TEL-uri-value = URI
 653: 
 654:      TEL-param =/ type-param / pid-param / pref-param / altid-param
 655:                 / any-param
 656: 
 657:      type-param-tel = "text" / "voice" / "fax" / "cell" / "video"
 658:                     / "pager" / "textphone" / iana-token / x-name
 659:        ; type-param-tel MUST NOT be used with a property other than TEL.
 660: 
 661:    Example:
 662: 
 663:      TEL;VALUE=uri;PREF=1;TYPE="voice,home":tel:+1-555-555-5555;ext=5555
 664:      TEL;VALUE=uri;TYPE=home:tel:+33-01-23-45-67
 665: 
 666:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-6.4.1
 667:    */
 668:   const TEL = 'TEL';
 669:   /**
 670:    * Purpose:  To specify the electronic mail address for communication
 671:       with the object the vCard represents.
 672: 
 673:    Value type:  A single text value.
 674: 
 675:    Cardinality:  *
 676: 
 677:    Special notes:  The property can include tye "PREF" parameter to
 678:       indicate a preferred-use email address when more than one is
 679:       specified.
 680: 
 681:       Even though the value is free-form UTF-8 text, it is likely to be
 682:       interpreted by a Mail User Agent (MUA) as an "addr-spec", as
 683:       defined in [RFC5322], Section 3.4.1.  Readers should also be aware
 684:       of the current work toward internationalized email addresses
 685:       [RFC5335bis].
 686: 
 687:    ABNF:
 688: 
 689:      EMAIL-param = "VALUE=text" / pid-param / pref-param / type-param
 690:                  / altid-param / any-param
 691:      EMAIL-value = text
 692: 
 693:    Example:
 694: 
 695:            EMAIL;TYPE=work:jqpublic@xyz.example.com
 696: 
 697:            EMAIL;PREF=1:jane_doe@example.com
 698: 
 699:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-6.4.2
 700:    */
 701:   const EMAIL = 'EMAIL';
 702:   /**
 703:    * Purpose:  To specify the URI for instant messaging and presence
 704:       protocol communications with the object the vCard represents.
 705: 
 706:    Value type:  A single URI.
 707: 
 708:    Cardinality:  *
 709: 
 710:    Special notes:  The property may include the "PREF" parameter to
 711:       indicate that this is a preferred address and has the same
 712:       semantics as the "PREF" parameter in a TEL property.
 713:       If this property's value is a URI that can be used for voice
 714:       and/or video, the TEL property (Section 6.4.1) SHOULD be used in
 715:       addition to this property.
 716: 
 717:       This property is adapted from [RFC4770], which is made obsolete by
 718:       this document.
 719: 
 720:    ABNF:
 721: 
 722:      IMPP-param = "VALUE=uri" / pid-param / pref-param / type-param
 723:                 / mediatype-param / altid-param / any-param
 724:      IMPP-value = URI
 725: 
 726:    Example:
 727: 
 728:        IMPP;PREF=1:xmpp:alice@example.com
 729: 
 730:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-6.4.3
 731:    */
 732:   const IMPP = 'IMPP';
 733:   /**
 734:    * Purpose:  To specify the language(s) that may be used for contacting
 735:       the entity associated with the vCard.
 736: 
 737:    Value type:  A single language-tag value.
 738: 
 739:    Cardinality:  *
 740: 
 741:    ABNF:
 742: 
 743:      LANG-param = "VALUE=language-tag" / pid-param / pref-param
 744:                 / altid-param / type-param / any-param
 745:      LANG-value = Language-Tag
 746: 
 747:    Example:
 748: 
 749:        LANG;TYPE=work;PREF=1:en
 750:        LANG;TYPE=work;PREF=2:fr
 751:        LANG;TYPE=home:fr
 752: 
 753:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-6.4.4
 754:    */
 755:   const LANG = 'LANG';
 756: 
 757:   // Geographical Properties
 758:   /**
 759:    * Purpose:  To specify information related to the time zone of the
 760:       object the vCard represents.
 761: 
 762:    Value type:  The default is a single text value.  It can also be
 763:       reset to a single URI or utc-offset value.
 764: 
 765:    Cardinality:  *
 766: 
 767:    Special notes:  It is expected that names from the public-domain
 768:       Olson database [TZ-DB] will be used, but this is not a
 769:       restriction.  See also [IANA-TZ].
 770: 
 771:       Efforts are currently being directed at creating a standard URI
 772:       scheme for expressing time zone information.  Usage of such a
 773:       scheme would ensure a high level of interoperability between
 774:       implementations that support it.
 775: 
 776:       Note that utc-offset values SHOULD NOT be used because the UTC
 777:       offset varies with time -- not just because of the usual daylight
 778:       saving time shifts that occur in may regions, but often entire
 779:       regions will "re-base" their overall offset.  The actual offset
 780:       may be +/- 1 hour (or perhaps a little more) than the one given.
 781: 
 782:    ABNF:
 783: 
 784:      TZ-param = "VALUE=" ("text" / "uri" / "utc-offset")
 785:      TZ-value = text / URI / utc-offset
 786:        ; Value and parameter MUST match.
 787: 
 788:      TZ-param =/ altid-param / pid-param / pref-param / type-param
 789:                / mediatype-param / any-param
 790: 
 791:    Examples:
 792: 
 793:      TZ:Raleigh/North America
 794: 
 795:      TZ;VALUE=utc-offset:-0500
 796:        ; Note: utc-offset format is NOT RECOMMENDED.
 797: 
 798:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-6.5.1
 799:    */
 800:   const TZ = 'TZ';
 801:   /**
 802:    * Purpose:  To specify information related to the global positioning of
 803:       the object the vCard represents.
 804: 
 805:    Value type:  A single URI.
 806: 
 807:    Cardinality:  *
 808: 
 809:    Special notes:  The "geo" URI scheme [RFC5870] is particularly well
 810:       suited for this property, but other schemes MAY be used.
 811: 
 812:    ABNF:
 813: 
 814:      GEO-param = "VALUE=uri" / pid-param / pref-param / type-param
 815:                / mediatype-param / altid-param / any-param
 816:      GEO-value = URI
 817: 
 818:    Example:
 819: 
 820:            GEO:geo:37.386013,-122.082932
 821: 
 822:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-6.5.2
 823:    */
 824:   const GEO = 'GEO';
 825: 
 826:   // Organizational Properties
 827:   /**
 828:    * Purpose:  To specify the position or job of the object the vCard
 829:       represents.
 830: 
 831:    Value type:  A single text value.
 832: 
 833:    Cardinality:  *
 834: 
 835:    Special notes:  This property is based on the X.520 Title attribute
 836:       [CCITT.X520.1988].
 837: 
 838:    ABNF:
 839: 
 840:      TITLE-param = "VALUE=text" / language-param / pid-param
 841:                  / pref-param / altid-param / type-param / any-param
 842:      TITLE-value = text
 843: 
 844:    Example:
 845: 
 846:            TITLE:Research Scientist
 847: 
 848:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-6.6.1
 849:    */
 850:   const TITLE = 'TITLE';
 851:   /**
 852:    * Purpose:  To specify the function or part played in a particular
 853:       situation by the object the vCard represents.
 854: 
 855:    Value type:  A single text value.
 856: 
 857:    Cardinality:  *
 858: 
 859:    Special notes:  This property is based on the X.520 Business Category
 860:       explanatory attribute [CCITT.X520.1988].  This property is
 861:       included as an organizational type to avoid confusion with the
 862:       semantics of the TITLE property and incorrect usage of that
 863:       property when the semantics of this property is intended.
 864: 
 865:    ABNF:
 866: 
 867:      ROLE-param = "VALUE=text" / language-param / pid-param / pref-param
 868:                 / type-param / altid-param / any-param
 869:      ROLE-value = text
 870: 
 871:    Example:
 872: 
 873:            ROLE:Project Leader
 874: 
 875:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-6.6.2
 876:    */
 877:   const ROLE = 'ROLE';
 878:   /**
 879:    * Purpose:  To specify a graphic image of a logo associated with the
 880:       object the vCard represents.
 881: 
 882:    Value type:  A single URI.
 883: 
 884:    Cardinality:  *
 885: 
 886:    ABNF:
 887: 
 888:      LOGO-param = "VALUE=uri" / language-param / pid-param / pref-param
 889:                 / type-param / mediatype-param / altid-param / any-param
 890:      LOGO-value = URI
 891: 
 892:    Examples:
 893: 
 894:      LOGO:http://www.example.com/pub/logos/abccorp.jpg
 895: 
 896:      LOGO:data:image/jpeg;base64,MIICajCCAdOgAwIBAgICBEUwDQYJKoZIhvc
 897:       AQEEBQAwdzELMAkGA1UEBhMCVVMxLDAqBgNVBAoTI05ldHNjYXBlIENvbW11bm
 898:       ljYXRpb25zIENvcnBvcmF0aW9uMRwwGgYDVQQLExNJbmZvcm1hdGlvbiBTeXN0
 899:       <...the remainder of base64-encoded data...>
 900: 
 901:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-6.6.3
 902:    */
 903:   const LOGO = 'LOGO';
 904:   /**
 905:    * Purpose:  To specify the organizational name and units associated
 906:       with the vCard.
 907: 
 908:    Value type:  A single structured text value consisting of components
 909:       separated by the SEMICOLON character (U+003B).
 910: 
 911:    Cardinality:  *
 912: 
 913:    Special notes:  The property is based on the X.520 Organization Name
 914:       and Organization Unit attributes [CCITT.X520.1988].  The property
 915:       value is a structured type consisting of the organization name,
 916:       followed by zero or more levels of organizational unit names.
 917: 
 918:       The SORT-AS parameter MAY be applied to this property.
 919: 
 920:    ABNF:
 921: 
 922:      ORG-param = "VALUE=text" / sort-as-param / language-param
 923:                / pid-param / pref-param / altid-param / type-param
 924:                / any-param
 925:      ORG-value = component *(";" component)
 926: 
 927:    Example: A property value consisting of an organizational name,
 928:    organizational unit #1 name, and organizational unit #2 name.
 929: 
 930:            ORG:ABC\, Inc.;North American Division;Marketing
 931: 
 932:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-6.6.4
 933:    */
 934:   const ORG = 'ORG';
 935:   /**
 936:    * Purpose:  To include a member in the group this vCard represents.
 937: 
 938:    Value type:  A single URI.  It MAY refer to something other than a
 939:       vCard object.  For example, an email distribution list could
 940:       employ the "mailto" URI scheme [RFC6068] for efficiency.
 941: 
 942:    Cardinality:  *
 943: 
 944:    Special notes:  This property MUST NOT be present unless the value of
 945:       the KIND property is "group".
 946: 
 947:    ABNF:
 948: 
 949:      MEMBER-param = "VALUE=uri" / pid-param / pref-param / altid-param
 950:                   / mediatype-param / any-param
 951:      MEMBER-value = URI
 952: 
 953:    Examples:
 954: 
 955:      BEGIN:VCARD
 956:      VERSION:4.0
 957:      KIND:group
 958:      FN:The Doe family
 959:      MEMBER:urn:uuid:03a0e51f-d1aa-4385-8a53-e29025acd8af
 960:      MEMBER:urn:uuid:b8767877-b4a1-4c70-9acc-505d3819e519
 961:      END:VCARD
 962:      BEGIN:VCARD
 963:      VERSION:4.0
 964:      FN:John Doe
 965:      UID:urn:uuid:03a0e51f-d1aa-4385-8a53-e29025acd8af
 966:      END:VCARD
 967:      BEGIN:VCARD
 968:      VERSION:4.0
 969:      FN:Jane Doe
 970:      UID:urn:uuid:b8767877-b4a1-4c70-9acc-505d3819e519
 971:      END:VCARD
 972: 
 973:      BEGIN:VCARD
 974:      VERSION:4.0
 975:      KIND:group
 976:      FN:Funky distribution list
 977:      MEMBER:mailto:subscriber1@example.com
 978:      MEMBER:xmpp:subscriber2@example.com
 979:      MEMBER:sip:subscriber3@example.com
 980:      MEMBER:tel:+1-418-555-5555
 981:      END:VCARD
 982: 
 983:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-6.6.5
 984:    */
 985:   const MEMBER = 'MEMBER';
 986:   /**
 987:    * Purpose:  To specify a relationship between another entity and the
 988:       entity represented by this vCard.
 989: 
 990:    Value type:  A single URI.  It can also be reset to a single text
 991:       value.  The text value can be used to specify textual information.
 992: 
 993:    Cardinality:  *
 994: 
 995:    Special notes:  The TYPE parameter MAY be used to characterize the
 996:       related entity.  It contains a comma-separated list of values that
 997:       are registered with IANA as described in Section 10.2.  The
 998:       registry is pre-populated with the values defined in [xfn].  This
 999:       document also specifies two additional values:
1000: 
1001:       agent:  an entity who may sometimes act on behalf of the entity
1002:          associated with the vCard.
1003: 
1004:       emergency:  indicates an emergency contact
1005: 
1006:    ABNF:
1007: 
1008:      RELATED-param = RELATED-param-uri / RELATED-param-text
1009:      RELATED-value = URI / text
1010:        ; Parameter and value MUST match.
1011: 
1012:      RELATED-param-uri = "VALUE=uri" / mediatype-param
1013:      RELATED-param-text = "VALUE=text" / language-param
1014: 
1015:      RELATED-param =/ pid-param / pref-param / altid-param / type-param
1016:                     / any-param
1017: 
1018:      type-param-related = related-type-value *("," related-type-value)
1019:        ; type-param-related MUST NOT be used with a property other than
1020:        ; RELATED.
1021: 
1022:      related-type-value = "contact" / "acquaintance" / "friend" / "met"
1023:                         / "co-worker" / "colleague" / "co-resident"
1024:                         / "neighbor" / "child" / "parent"
1025:                         / "sibling" / "spouse" / "kin" / "muse"
1026:                         / "crush" / "date" / "sweetheart" / "me"
1027:                         / "agent" / "emergency"
1028: 
1029:    Examples:
1030: 
1031:    RELATED;TYPE=friend:urn:uuid:f81d4fae-7dec-11d0-a765-00a0c91e6bf6
1032:    RELATED;TYPE=contact:http://example.com/directory/jdoe.vcf
1033:    RELATED;TYPE=co-worker;VALUE=text:Please contact my assistant Jane
1034:     Doe for any inquiries.
1035: 
1036:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-6.6.6
1037:    */
1038:   const RELATED = 'RELATED';
1039: 
1040:   // Explanatory Properties
1041:   /**
1042:    * Purpose:  To specify application category information about the
1043:       vCard, also known as "tags".
1044: 
1045:    Value type:  One or more text values separated by a COMMA character
1046:       (U+002C).
1047: 
1048:    Cardinality:  *
1049: 
1050:    ABNF:
1051: 
1052:      CATEGORIES-param = "VALUE=text" / pid-param / pref-param
1053:                       / type-param / altid-param / any-param
1054:      CATEGORIES-value = text-list
1055: 
1056:    Example:
1057: 
1058:            CATEGORIES:TRAVEL AGENT
1059: 
1060:            CATEGORIES:INTERNET,IETF,INDUSTRY,INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY
1061: 
1062:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-6.7.1
1063:    */
1064:   const CATEGORIES = 'CATEGORIES';
1065:   /**
1066:    * Purpose:  To specify supplemental information or a comment that is
1067:       associated with the vCard.
1068: 
1069:    Value type:  A single text value.
1070: 
1071:    Cardinality:  *
1072: 
1073:    Special notes:  The property is based on the X.520 Description
1074:       attribute [CCITT.X520.1988].
1075: 
1076:    ABNF:
1077: 
1078:      NOTE-param = "VALUE=text" / language-param / pid-param / pref-param
1079:                 / type-param / altid-param / any-param
1080:      NOTE-value = text
1081: 
1082:    Example:
1083: 
1084:            NOTE:This fax number is operational 0800 to 1715
1085:              EST\, Mon-Fri.
1086: 
1087:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-6.7.2
1088:    */
1089:   const NOTE = 'NOTE';
1090:   /**
1091:    * Purpose:  To specify the identifier for the product that created the
1092:       vCard object.
1093: 
1094:    Type value:  A single text value.
1095: 
1096:    Cardinality:  *1
1097: 
1098:    Special notes:  Implementations SHOULD use a method such as that
1099:       specified for Formal Public Identifiers in [ISO9070] or for
1100:       Universal Resource Names in [RFC3406] to ensure that the text
1101:       value is unique.
1102: 
1103:    ABNF:
1104: 
1105:      PRODID-param = "VALUE=text" / any-param
1106:      PRODID-value = text
1107: 
1108:    Example:
1109: 
1110:            PRODID:-//ONLINE DIRECTORY//NONSGML Version 1//EN
1111: 
1112:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-6.7.3
1113:    */
1114:   const PRODID = 'PRODID';
1115:   /**
1116:    * Purpose:  To specify revision information about the current vCard.
1117: 
1118:    Value type:  A single timestamp value.
1119: 
1120:    Cardinality:  *1
1121: 
1122:    Special notes:  The value distinguishes the current revision of the
1123:       information in this vCard for other renditions of the information.
1124: 
1125:    ABNF:
1126: 
1127:      REV-param = "VALUE=timestamp" / any-param
1128:      REV-value = timestamp
1129: 
1130:    Example:
1131: 
1132:            REV:19951031T222710Z
1133: 
1134:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-6.7.4
1135:    */
1136:   const REV = 'REV';
1137:   /**
1138:    * Purpose:  To specify a digital sound content information that
1139:       annotates some aspect of the vCard.  This property is often used
1140:       to specify the proper pronunciation of the name property value of
1141:       the vCard.
1142: 
1143:    Value type:  A single URI.
1144: 
1145:    Cardinality:  *
1146: 
1147:    ABNF:
1148: 
1149:      SOUND-param = "VALUE=uri" / language-param / pid-param / pref-param
1150:                  / type-param / mediatype-param / altid-param
1151:                  / any-param
1152:      SOUND-value = URI
1153: 
1154:    Example:
1155: 
1156:      SOUND:CID:JOHNQPUBLIC.part8.19960229T080000.xyzMail@example.com
1157: 
1158:      SOUND:data:audio/basic;base64,MIICajCCAdOgAwIBAgICBEUwDQYJKoZIh
1159:       AQEEBQAwdzELMAkGA1UEBhMCVVMxLDAqBgNVBAoTI05ldHNjYXBlIENvbW11bm
1160:       ljYXRpb25zIENvcnBvcmF0aW9uMRwwGgYDVQQLExNJbmZvcm1hdGlvbiBTeXN0
1161:       <...the remainder of base64-encoded data...>
1162: 
1163:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-6.7.5
1164:    */
1165:   const SOUND = 'SOUND';
1166:   /**
1167:    * Purpose:  To specify a value that represents a globally unique
1168:       identifier corresponding to the entity associated with the vCard.
1169: 
1170:    Value type:  A single URI value.  It MAY also be reset to free-form
1171:       text.
1172: 
1173:    Cardinality:  *1
1174: 
1175:    Special notes:  This property is used to uniquely identify the object
1176:       that the vCard represents.  The "uuid" URN namespace defined in
1177:       [RFC4122] is particularly well suited to this task, but other URI
1178:       schemes MAY be used.  Free-form text MAY also be used.
1179: 
1180:    ABNF:
1181: 
1182:      UID-param = UID-uri-param / UID-text-param
1183:      UID-value = UID-uri-value / UID-text-value
1184:        ; Value and parameter MUST match.
1185: 
1186:      UID-uri-param = "VALUE=uri"
1187:      UID-uri-value = URI
1188: 
1189:      UID-text-param = "VALUE=text"
1190:      UID-text-value = text
1191: 
1192:      UID-param =/ any-param
1193: 
1194:    Example:
1195: 
1196:            UID:urn:uuid:f81d4fae-7dec-11d0-a765-00a0c91e6bf6
1197: 
1198:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-6.7.6
1199:    */
1200:   const UID = 'UID';
1201:   /**
1202:    * Purpose:  To give a global meaning to a local PID source identifier.
1203: 
1204:    Value type:  A semicolon-separated pair of values.  The first field
1205:       is a small integer corresponding to the second field of a PID
1206:       parameter instance.  The second field is a URI.  The "uuid" URN
1207:       namespace defined in [RFC4122] is particularly well suited to this
1208:       task, but other URI schemes MAY be used.
1209: 
1210:    Cardinality:  *
1211: 
1212:    Special notes:  PID source identifiers (the source identifier is the
1213:       second field in a PID parameter instance) are small integers that
1214:       only have significance within the scope of a single vCard
1215:       instance.  Each distinct source identifier present in a vCard MUST
1216:       have an associated CLIENTPIDMAP.  See Section 7 for more details
1217:       on the usage of CLIENTPIDMAP.
1218: 
1219:       PID source identifiers MUST be strictly positive.  Zero is not
1220:       allowed.
1221: 
1222:       As a special exception, the PID parameter MUST NOT be applied to
1223:       this property.
1224: 
1225:    ABNF:
1226: 
1227:      CLIENTPIDMAP-param = any-param
1228:      CLIENTPIDMAP-value = 1*DIGIT ";" URI
1229: 
1230:    Example:
1231: 
1232:      TEL;PID=3.1,4.2;VALUE=uri:tel:+1-555-555-5555
1233:      EMAIL;PID=4.1,5.2:jdoe@example.com
1234:      CLIENTPIDMAP:1;urn:uuid:3df403f4-5924-4bb7-b077-3c711d9eb34b
1235:      CLIENTPIDMAP:2;urn:uuid:d89c9c7a-2e1b-4832-82de-7e992d95faa5
1236: 
1237:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-6.7.7
1238:    */
1239:   const CLIENTPIDMAP = 'CLIENTPIDMAP';
1240:   /**
1241:    * Purpose:  To specify a uniform resource locator associated with the
1242:       object to which the vCard refers.  Examples for individuals
1243:       include personal web sites, blogs, and social networking site
1244:       identifiers.
1245: 
1246:    Cardinality:  *
1247: 
1248:    Value type:  A single uri value.
1249: 
1250:    ABNF:
1251: 
1252:      URL-param = "VALUE=uri" / pid-param / pref-param / type-param
1253:                / mediatype-param / altid-param / any-param
1254:      URL-value = URI
1255: 
1256:    Example:
1257: 
1258:            URL:http://example.org/restaurant.french/~chezchic.html
1259: 
1260:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-6.7.8
1261:    */
1262:   const URL = 'URL';
1263:   /**
1264:    * Purpose:  To specify the version of the vCard specification used to
1265:       format this vCard.
1266: 
1267:    Value type:  A single text value.
1268: 
1269:    Cardinality:  1
1270: 
1271:    Special notes:  This property MUST be present in the vCard object,
1272:       and it must appear immediately after BEGIN:VCARD.  The value MUST
1273:       be "4.0" if the vCard corresponds to this specification.  Note
1274:       that earlier versions of vCard allowed this property to be placed
1275:       anywhere in the vCard object, or even to be absent.
1276: 
1277:    ABNF:
1278: 
1279:      VERSION-param = "VALUE=text" / any-param
1280:      VERSION-value = "4.0"
1281: 
1282:    Example:
1283: 
1284:            VERSION:4.0
1285: 
1286:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-6.7.9
1287:    */
1288:   const VERSION = 'VERSION';
1289: 
1290:   // Security Properties
1291:   /**
1292:    * Purpose:  To specify a public key or authentication certificate
1293:       associated with the object that the vCard represents.
1294: 
1295:    Value type:  A single URI.  It can also be reset to a text value.
1296: 
1297:    Cardinality:  *
1298: 
1299:    ABNF:
1300: 
1301:      KEY-param = KEY-uri-param / KEY-text-param
1302:      KEY-value = KEY-uri-value / KEY-text-value
1303:        ; Value and parameter MUST match.
1304: 
1305:      KEY-uri-param = "VALUE=uri" / mediatype-param
1306:      KEY-uri-value = URI
1307: 
1308:      KEY-text-param = "VALUE=text"
1309:      KEY-text-value = text
1310: 
1311:      KEY-param =/ altid-param / pid-param / pref-param / type-param
1312:                 / any-param
1313: 
1314:    Examples:
1315: 
1316:      KEY:http://www.example.com/keys/jdoe.cer
1317: 
1318:      KEY;MEDIATYPE=application/pgp-keys:ftp://example.com/keys/jdoe
1319: 
1320:      KEY:data:application/pgp-keys;base64,MIICajCCAdOgAwIBAgICBE
1321:       UwDQYJKoZIhvcNAQEEBQAwdzELMAkGA1UEBhMCVVMxLDAqBgNVBAoTI05l
1322:       <... remainder of base64-encoded data ...>
1323: 
1324:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-6.8.1
1325:    */
1326:   const KEY = 'KEY';
1327: 
1328:   // Calendar Properties
1329:   /**
1330:    * Purpose:  To specify the URI for the busy time associated with the
1331:       object that the vCard represents.
1332: 
1333:    Value type:  A single URI value.
1334: 
1335:    Cardinality:  *
1336: 
1337:    Special notes:  Where multiple FBURL properties are specified, the
1338:       default FBURL property is indicated with the PREF parameter.  The
1339:       FTP [RFC1738] or HTTP [RFC2616] type of URI points to an iCalendar
1340:       [RFC5545] object associated with a snapshot of the next few weeks
1341:       or months of busy time data.  If the iCalendar object is
1342:       represented as a file or document, its file extension should be
1343:       ".ifb".
1344: 
1345:    ABNF:
1346: 
1347:      FBURL-param = "VALUE=uri" / pid-param / pref-param / type-param
1348:                  / mediatype-param / altid-param / any-param
1349:      FBURL-value = URI
1350: 
1351:    Examples:
1352: 
1353:      FBURL;PREF=1:http://www.example.com/busy/janedoe
1354:      FBURL;MEDIATYPE=text/calendar:ftp://example.com/busy/project-a.ifb
1355: 
1356:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-6.9.1
1357:    */
1358:   const FBURL = 'FBURL';
1359:   /**
1360:    * Purpose:  To specify the calendar user address [RFC5545] to which a
1361:       scheduling request [RFC5546] should be sent for the object
1362:       represented by the vCard.
1363: 
1364:    Value type:  A single URI value.
1365: 
1366:    Cardinality:  *
1367: 
1368:    Special notes:  Where multiple CALADRURI properties are specified,
1369:       the default CALADRURI property is indicated with the PREF
1370:       parameter.
1371: 
1372:    ABNF:
1373: 
1374:      CALADRURI-param = "VALUE=uri" / pid-param / pref-param / type-param
1375:                      / mediatype-param / altid-param / any-param
1376:      CALADRURI-value = URI
1377: 
1378:    Example:
1379: 
1380:      CALADRURI;PREF=1:mailto:janedoe@example.com
1381:      CALADRURI:http://example.com/calendar/jdoe
1382: 
1383:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-6.9.2
1384:    */
1385:   const CALADRURI = 'CALADRURI';
1386:   /**
1387:    * Purpose:  To specify the URI for a calendar associated with the
1388:       object represented by the vCard.
1389: 
1390:    Value type:  A single URI value.
1391: 
1392:    Cardinality:  *
1393: 
1394:    Special notes:  Where multiple CALURI properties are specified, the
1395:       default CALURI property is indicated with the PREF parameter.  The
1396:       property should contain a URI pointing to an iCalendar [RFC5545]
1397:       object associated with a snapshot of the user's calendar store.
1398:       If the iCalendar object is represented as a file or document, its
1399:       file extension should be ".ics".
1400: 
1401:    ABNF:
1402: 
1403:      CALURI-param = "VALUE=uri" / pid-param / pref-param / type-param
1404:                   / mediatype-param / altid-param / any-param
1405:      CALURI-value = URI
1406: 
1407:    Examples:
1408: 
1409:      CALURI;PREF=1:http://cal.example.com/calA
1410:      CALURI;MEDIATYPE=text/calendar:ftp://ftp.example.com/calA.ics
1411: 
1412:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-6.9.3
1413:    */
1414:   const CALURI = 'CALURI';
1415: 
1416:   // Property Value Data Types
1417:   /**
1418:    *  "text": The "text" value type should be used to identify values that
1419:    contain human-readable text.  As for the language, it is controlled
1420:    by the LANGUAGE property parameter defined in Section 5.1.
1421: 
1422:    Examples for "text":
1423: 
1424:        this is a text value
1425:        this is one value,this is another
1426:        this is a single value\, with a comma encoded
1427: 
1428:    A formatted text line break in a text value type MUST be represented
1429:    as the character sequence backslash (U+005C) followed by a Latin
1430:    small letter n (U+006E) or a Latin capital letter N (U+004E), that
1431:    is, "\n" or "\N".
1432: 
1433:    For example, a multiple line NOTE value of:
1434: 
1435:        Mythical Manager
1436:        Hyjinx Software Division
1437:        BabsCo, Inc.
1438: 
1439:    could be represented as:
1440: 
1441:        NOTE:Mythical Manager\nHyjinx Software Division\n
1442:         BabsCo\, Inc.\n
1443: 
1444:    demonstrating the \n literal formatted line break technique, the
1445:    CRLF-followed-by-space line folding technique, and the backslash
1446:    escape technique.
1447: 
1448:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-4.1
1449:    */
1450:   const TEXT = 'TEXT';
1451:   /**
1452:    * "uri": The "uri" value type should be used to identify values that
1453:    are referenced by a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) instead of
1454:    encoded in-line.  These value references might be used if the value
1455:    is too large, or otherwise undesirable to include directly.  The
1456:    format for the URI is as defined in Section 3 of [RFC3986].  Note
1457:    that the value of a property of type "uri" is what the URI points to,
1458:    not the URI itself.
1459: 
1460:    Examples for "uri":
1461: 
1462:        http://www.example.com/my/picture.jpg
1463:        ldap://ldap.example.com/cn=babs%20jensen
1464: 
1465:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-4.2
1466:    */
1467:   const URI = 'URI';
1468:   /**
1469:    * A calendar date as specified in [ISO.8601.2004], Section 4.1.2.
1470: 
1471:    Reduced accuracy, as specified in [ISO.8601.2004], Sections 4.1.2.3
1472:    a) and b), but not c), is permitted.
1473: 
1474:    Expanded representation, as specified in [ISO.8601.2004], Section
1475:    4.1.4, is forbidden.
1476: 
1477:    Truncated representation, as specified in [ISO.8601.2000], Sections
1478:    5.2.1.3 d), e), and f), is permitted.
1479: 
1480:    Examples for "date":
1481: 
1482:              19850412
1483:              1985-04
1484:              1985
1485:              --0412
1486:              ---12
1487: 
1488:    Note the use of YYYY-MM in the second example above.  YYYYMM is
1489:    disallowed to prevent confusion with YYMMDD.  Note also that
1490:    YYYY-MM-DD is disallowed since we are using the basic format instead
1491:    of the extended format.
1492: 
1493:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-4.3.1
1494:    */
1495:   const DATE = 'DATE';
1496:   /**
1497:    * A time of day as specified in [ISO.8601.2004], Section 4.2.
1498: 
1499:    Reduced accuracy, as specified in [ISO.8601.2004], Section 4.2.2.3,
1500:    is permitted.
1501: 
1502:    Representation with decimal fraction, as specified in
1503:    [ISO.8601.2004], Section 4.2.2.4, is forbidden.
1504: 
1505:    The midnight hour is always represented by 00, never 24 (see
1506:    [ISO.8601.2004], Section 4.2.3).
1507: 
1508:    Truncated representation, as specified in [ISO.8601.2000], Sections
1509:    5.3.1.4 a), b), and c), is permitted.
1510: 
1511:    Examples for "time":
1512: 
1513:              102200
1514:              1022
1515:              10
1516:              -2200
1517:              --00
1518:              102200Z
1519:              102200-0800
1520: 
1521:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-4.3.2
1522:    */
1523:   const TIME = 'TIME';
1524:   /**
1525:    * A date and time of day combination as specified in [ISO.8601.2004],
1526:    Section 4.3.
1527: 
1528:    Truncation of the date part, as specified in [ISO.8601.2000], Section
1529:    5.4.2 c), is permitted.
1530: 
1531:    Examples for "date-time":
1532: 
1533:              19961022T140000
1534:              --1022T1400
1535:              ---22T14
1536: 
1537:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-4.3.3
1538:    */
1539:   const DATE_TIME = 'DATE-TIME';
1540:   /**
1541:    * Either a DATE-TIME, a DATE, or a TIME value.  To allow unambiguous
1542:    interpretation, a stand-alone TIME value is always preceded by a "T".
1543: 
1544:    Examples for "date-and-or-time":
1545: 
1546:              19961022T140000
1547:              --1022T1400
1548:              ---22T14
1549:              19850412
1550:              1985-04
1551:              1985
1552:              --0412
1553:              ---12
1554:              T102200
1555:              T1022
1556:              T10
1557:              T-2200
1558:              T--00
1559:              T102200Z
1560:              T102200-0800
1561: 
1562:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-4.3.4
1563:    */
1564:   const DATE_AND_OR_TIME = 'DATE-AND-OR-TIME';
1565:   /**
1566:    * A complete date and time of day combination as specified in
1567:    [ISO.8601.2004], Section 4.3.2.
1568: 
1569:    Examples for "timestamp":
1570: 
1571:              19961022T140000
1572:              19961022T140000Z
1573:              19961022T140000-05
1574:              19961022T140000-0500
1575: 
1576:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-4.3.5
1577:    */
1578:   const TIMESTAMP = 'TIMESTAMP';
1579:   /**
1580:    * "boolean": The "boolean" value type is used to express boolean
1581:    values.  These values are case-insensitive.
1582: 
1583:    Examples:
1584: 
1585:        TRUE
1586:        false
1587:        True
1588: 
1589:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-4.4
1590:    */
1591:   const BOOLEAN = 'BOOLEAN';
1592:   /**
1593:    * "integer": The "integer" value type is used to express signed
1594:    integers in decimal format.  If sign is not specified, the value is
1595:    assumed positive "+".  Multiple "integer" values can be specified
1596:    using the comma-separated notation.  The maximum value is
1597:    9223372036854775807, and the minimum value is -9223372036854775808.
1598:    These limits correspond to a signed 64-bit integer using two's-
1599:    complement arithmetic.
1600: 
1601:    Examples:
1602: 
1603:        1234567890
1604:        -1234556790
1605:        +1234556790,432109876
1606: 
1607:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-4.5
1608:    */
1609:   const INTEGER = 'INTEGER';
1610:   /**
1611:    * "float": The "float" value type is used to express real numbers.  If
1612:    sign is not specified, the value is assumed positive "+".  Multiple
1613:    "float" values can be specified using the comma-separated notation.
1614:    Implementations MUST support a precision equal or better than that of
1615:    the IEEE "binary64" format [IEEE.754.2008].
1616: 
1617:       Note: Scientific notation is disallowed.  Implementers wishing to
1618:       use their favorite language's %f formatting should be careful.
1619: 
1620:    Examples:
1621: 
1622:        20.30
1623:        1000000.0000001
1624:        1.333,3.14
1625: 
1626:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-4.6
1627:    */
1628:   const FLOAT = 'FLOAT';
1629:   /**
1630:    * "utc-offset": The "utc-offset" value type specifies that the property
1631:    value is a signed offset from UTC.  This value type can be specified
1632:    in the TZ property.
1633: 
1634:    The value type is an offset from Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).
1635:    It is specified as a positive or negative difference in units of
1636:    hours and minutes (e.g., +hhmm).  The time is specified as a 24-hour
1637:    clock.  Hour values are from 00 to 23, and minute values are from 00
1638:    to 59.  Hour and minutes are 2 digits with high-order zeroes required
1639:    to maintain digit count.  The basic format for ISO 8601 UTC offsets
1640:    MUST be used.
1641: 
1642:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-4.7
1643:    */
1644:   const UTC_OFFSET = 'UTC-OFFSET';
1645:   /**
1646:    * "language-tag": A single language tag, as defined in [RFC5646].
1647:    *
1648:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-4.8
1649:    */
1650:   const LANGUAGE_TAG = 'LANGUAGE-TAG';
1651: 
1652:   // Property Parameters
1653:   /**
1654:    * The LANGUAGE property parameter is used to identify data in multiple
1655:    languages.  There is no concept of "default" language, except as
1656:    specified by any "Content-Language" MIME header parameter that is
1657:    present [RFC3282].  The value of the LANGUAGE property parameter is a
1658:    language tag as defined in Section 2 of [RFC5646].
1659: 
1660:    Examples:
1661: 
1662:      ROLE;LANGUAGE=tr:hoca
1663: 
1664:    ABNF:
1665: 
1666:            language-param = "LANGUAGE=" Language-Tag
1667:              ; Language-Tag is defined in section 2.1 of RFC 5646
1668: 
1669:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-5.1
1670:    */
1671:   const LANGUAGE = 'LANGUAGE';
1672:   /**
1673:    * The VALUE parameter is OPTIONAL, used to identify the value type
1674:    (data type) and format of the value.  The use of these predefined
1675:    formats is encouraged even if the value parameter is not explicitly
1676:    used.  By defining a standard set of value types and their formats,
1677:    existing parsing and processing code can be leveraged.  The
1678:    predefined data type values MUST NOT be repeated in COMMA-separated
1679:    value lists except within the N, NICKNAME, ADR, and CATEGORIES
1680:    properties.
1681: 
1682:    ABNF:
1683: 
1684:      value-param = "VALUE=" value-type
1685: 
1686:      value-type = "text"
1687:                 / "uri"
1688:                 / "date"
1689:                 / "time"
1690:                 / "date-time"
1691:                 / "date-and-or-time"
1692:                 / "timestamp"
1693:                 / "boolean"
1694:                 / "integer"
1695:                 / "float"
1696:                 / "utc-offset"
1697:                 / "language-tag"
1698:                 / iana-token  ; registered as described in section 12
1699: 
1700: 
1701:                 / x-name
1702: 
1703:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-5.2
1704:    */
1705:   const VALUE = 'VALUE';
1706:   /**
1707:    * The PREF parameter is OPTIONAL and is used to indicate that the
1708:    corresponding instance of a property is preferred by the vCard
1709:    author.  Its value MUST be an integer between 1 and 100 that
1710:    quantifies the level of preference.  Lower values correspond to a
1711:    higher level of preference, with 1 being most preferred.
1712: 
1713:    When the parameter is absent, the default MUST be to interpret the
1714:    property instance as being least preferred.
1715: 
1716:    Note that the value of this parameter is to be interpreted only in
1717:    relation to values assigned to other instances of the same property
1718:    in the same vCard.  A given value, or the absence of a value, MUST
1719:    NOT be interpreted on its own.
1720: 
1721:    This parameter MAY be applied to any property that allows multiple
1722:    instances.
1723: 
1724:    ABNF:
1725: 
1726:            pref-param = "PREF=" (1*2DIGIT / "100")
1727:                                 ; An integer between 1 and 100.
1728: 
1729:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-5.3
1730:    */
1731:   const PREF = 'PREF';
1732:   /**
1733:    * The ALTID parameter is used to "tag" property instances as being
1734:    alternative representations of the same logical property.  For
1735:    example, translations of a property in multiple languages generates
1736:    multiple property instances having different LANGUAGE (Section 5.1)
1737:    parameter that are tagged with the same ALTID value.
1738: 
1739:    This parameter's value is treated as an opaque string.  Its sole
1740:    purpose is to be compared for equality against other ALTID parameter
1741:    values.
1742: 
1743:    Two property instances are considered alternative representations of
1744:    the same logical property if and only if their names as well as the
1745:    value of their ALTID parameters are identical.  Property instances
1746:    without the ALTID parameter MUST NOT be considered an alternative
1747:    representation of any other property instance.  Values for the ALTID
1748:    parameter are not globally unique: they MAY be reused for different
1749:    property names.
1750: 
1751:    Property instances having the same ALTID parameter value count as 1
1752:    toward cardinality.  Therefore, since N (Section 6.2.2) has
1753:    cardinality *1 and TITLE (Section 6.6.1) has cardinality *, these
1754:    three examples would be legal:
1755: 
1756:      N;ALTID=1;LANGUAGE=jp:<U+5C71><U+7530>;<U+592A><U+90CE>;;;
1757:      N;ALTID=1;LANGUAGE=en:Yamada;Taro;;;
1758:      (<U+XXXX> denotes a UTF8-encoded Unicode character.)
1759: 
1760:      TITLE;ALTID=1;LANGUAGE=fr:Patron
1761:      TITLE;ALTID=1;LANGUAGE=en:Boss
1762: 
1763:      TITLE;ALTID=1;LANGUAGE=fr:Patron
1764:      TITLE;ALTID=1;LANGUAGE=en:Boss
1765:      TITLE;ALTID=2;LANGUAGE=en:Chief vCard Evangelist
1766: 
1767:    while this one would not:
1768: 
1769:      N;ALTID=1;LANGUAGE=jp:<U+5C71><U+7530>;<U+592A><U+90CE>;;;
1770:      N:Yamada;Taro;;;
1771:      (Two instances of the N property.)
1772: 
1773:    and these three would be legal but questionable:
1774: 
1775:      TITLE;ALTID=1;LANGUAGE=fr:Patron
1776:      TITLE;ALTID=2;LANGUAGE=en:Boss
1777:      (Should probably have the same ALTID value.)
1778:      TITLE;ALTID=1;LANGUAGE=fr:Patron
1779:      TITLE:LANGUAGE=en:Boss
1780:      (Second line should probably have ALTID=1.)
1781: 
1782:      N;ALTID=1;LANGUAGE=jp:<U+5C71><U+7530>;<U+592A><U+90CE>;;;
1783:      N;ALTID=1;LANGUAGE=en:Yamada;Taro;;;
1784:      N;ALTID=1;LANGUAGE=en:Smith;John;;;
1785:      (The last line should probably have ALTID=2.  But that would be
1786:       illegal because N has cardinality *1.)
1787: 
1788:    The ALTID property MAY also be used in may contexts other than with
1789:    the LANGUAGE parameter.  Here's an example with two representations
1790:    of the same photo in different file formats:
1791: 
1792:      PHOTO;ALTID=1:data:image/jpeg;base64,...
1793:      PHOTO;ALTID=1;data:image/jp2;base64,...
1794: 
1795:    ABNF:
1796: 
1797:            altid-param = "ALTID=" param-value
1798: 
1799:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-5.4
1800:    */
1801:   const ALTID = 'ALTID';
1802:   /**
1803:    * The PID parameter is used to identify a specific property among
1804:    multiple instances.  It plays a role analogous to the UID property
1805:    (Section 6.7.6) on a per-property instead of per-vCard basis.  It MAY
1806:    appear more than once in a given property.  It MUST NOT appear on
1807:    properties that may have only one instance per vCard.  Its value is
1808:    either a single small positive integer or a pair of small positive
1809:    integers separated by a dot.  Multiple values may be encoded in a
1810:    single PID parameter by separating the values with a comma ",".  See
1811:    Section 7 for more details on its usage.
1812: 
1813:    ABNF:
1814: 
1815:            pid-param = "PID=" pid-value *("," pid-value)
1816:            pid-value = 1*DIGIT ["." 1*DIGIT]
1817: 
1818:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-5.5
1819:    */
1820:   const PID = 'PID';
1821:   /**
1822:    * The TYPE parameter has multiple, different uses.  In general, it is a
1823:    way of specifying class characteristics of the associated property.
1824:    Most of the time, its value is a comma-separated subset of a
1825:    predefined enumeration.  In this document, the following properties
1826:    make use of this parameter: FN, NICKNAME, PHOTO, ADR, TEL, EMAIL,
1827:    IMPP, LANG, TZ, GEO, TITLE, ROLE, LOGO, ORG, RELATED, CATEGORIES,
1828:    NOTE, SOUND, URL, KEY, FBURL, CALADRURI, and CALURI.  The TYPE
1829:    parameter MUST NOT be applied on other properties defined in this
1830:    document.
1831: 
1832:    The "work" and "home" values act like tags.  The "work" value implies
1833:    that the property is related to an individual's work place, while the
1834:    "home" value implies that the property is related to an individual's
1835:    personal life.  When neither "work" nor "home" is present, it is
1836:    implied that the property is related to both an individual's work
1837:    place and personal life in the case that the KIND property's value is
1838:    "individual", or to none in other cases.
1839: 
1840:    ABNF:
1841: 
1842:            type-param = "TYPE=" type-value *("," type-value)
1843: 
1844:            type-value = "work" / "home" / type-param-tel
1845:                       / type-param-related / iana-token / x-name
1846:              ; This is further defined in individual property sections.
1847: 
1848:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-5.6
1849:    */
1850:   const TYPE = 'TYPE';
1851:   /**
1852:    * The MEDIATYPE parameter is used with properties whose value is a URI.
1853:    Its use is OPTIONAL.  It provides a hint to the vCard consumer
1854:    application about the media type [RFC2046] of the resource identified
1855:    by the URI.  Some URI schemes do not need this parameter.  For
1856:    example, the "data" scheme allows the media type to be explicitly
1857:    indicated as part of the URI [RFC2397].  Another scheme, "http",
1858:    provides the media type as part of the URI resolution process, with
1859:    the Content-Type HTTP header [RFC2616].  The MEDIATYPE parameter is
1860:    intended to be used with URI schemes that do not provide such
1861:    functionality (e.g., "ftp" [RFC1738]).
1862: 
1863:    ABNF:
1864: 
1865:      mediatype-param = "MEDIATYPE=" mediatype
1866:      mediatype = type-name "/" subtype-name *( ";" attribute "=" value )
1867:        ; "attribute" and "value" are from [RFC2045]
1868:        ; "type-name" and "subtype-name" are from [RFC4288]
1869: 
1870:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-5.7
1871:    */
1872:   const MEDIATYPE = 'MEDIATYPE';
1873:   /**
1874:    * The CALSCALE parameter is identical to the CALSCALE property in
1875:    iCalendar (see [RFC5545], Section 3.7.1).  It is used to define the
1876:    calendar system in which a date or date-time value is expressed.  The
1877:    only value specified by iCalendar is "gregorian", which stands for
1878:    the Gregorian system.  It is the default when the parameter is
1879:    absent.  Additional values may be defined in extension documents and
1880:    registered with IANA (see Section 10.3.4).  A vCard implementation
1881:    MUST ignore properties with a CALSCALE parameter value that it does
1882:    not understand.
1883: 
1884:    ABNF:
1885: 
1886:            calscale-param = "CALSCALE=" calscale-value
1887: 
1888:            calscale-value = "gregorian" / iana-token / x-name
1889: 
1890:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-5.8
1891:    */
1892:   const CALSCALE = 'CALSCALE';
1893:   /**
1894:    * The "sort-as" parameter is used to specify the string to be used for
1895:    national-language-specific sorting.  Without this information,
1896:    sorting algorithms could incorrectly sort this vCard within a
1897:    sequence of sorted vCards.  When this property is present in a vCard,
1898:    then the given strings are used for sorting the vCard.
1899: 
1900:    This parameter's value is a comma-separated list that MUST have as
1901:    many or fewer elements as the corresponding property value has
1902:    components.  This parameter's value is case-sensitive.
1903: 
1904:    ABNF:
1905: 
1906:      sort-as-param = "SORT-AS=" sort-as-value
1907: 
1908:      sort-as-value = param-value *("," param-value)
1909: 
1910:    Examples: For the case of surname and given name sorting, the
1911:    following examples define common sort string usage with the N
1912:    property.
1913: 
1914:            FN:Rene van der Harten
1915:            N;SORT-AS="Harten,Rene":van der Harten;Rene,J.;Sir;R.D.O.N.
1916: 
1917:            FN:Robert Pau Shou Chang
1918:            N;SORT-AS="Pau Shou Chang,Robert":Shou Chang;Robert,Pau;;
1919: 
1920:            FN:Osamu Koura
1921:            N;SORT-AS="Koura,Osamu":Koura;Osamu;;
1922: 
1923:            FN:Oscar del Pozo
1924:            N;SORT-AS="Pozo,Oscar":del Pozo Triscon;Oscar;;
1925: 
1926:            FN:Chistine d'Aboville
1927:            N;SORT-AS="Aboville,Christine":d'Aboville;Christine;;
1928: 
1929:            FN:H. James de Mann
1930:            N;SORT-AS="Mann,James":de Mann;Henry,James;;
1931: 
1932:    If sorted by surname, the results would be:
1933: 
1934:            Christine d'Aboville
1935:            Rene van der Harten
1936:            Osamu Koura
1937:            H. James de Mann
1938:            Robert Pau Shou Chang
1939:            Oscar del Pozo
1940: 
1941:    If sorted by given name, the results would be:
1942: 
1943:            Christine d'Aboville
1944:            H. James de Mann
1945:            Osamu Koura
1946:            Oscar del Pozo
1947:            Rene van der Harten
1948:            Robert Pau Shou Chang
1949: 
1950:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-5.9
1951:    */
1952:   const SORT_AS = 'SORT-AS';
1953:   /**
1954:    * The GEO parameter can be used to indicate global positioning
1955:    information that is specific to an address.  Its value is the same as
1956:    that of the GEO property (see Section 6.5.2).
1957: 
1958:    ABNF:
1959: 
1960:      geo-parameter = "GEO=" DQUOTE URI DQUOTE
1961: 
1962:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-5.10
1963:    */
1964:   //const GEO = 'GEO';
1965:   /**
1966:    * The TZ parameter can be used to indicate time zone information that
1967:    is specific to an address.  Its value is the same as that of the TZ
1968:    property.
1969: 
1970:    ABNF:
1971: 
1972:      tz-parameter = "TZ=" (param-value / DQUOTE URI DQUOTE)
1973: 
1974:    * https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350#section-5.11
1975:    */
1976:   //const TZ = 'TZ';
1977: }
